summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear before the grand jury on August 16, 2019, and produce materials related to Jeffrey Epstein and the recipient's location and activities on August 9-10, 2019. The subpoena is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the signatory of the grand jury subpoena, issuing the command on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena as part of a grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Grand jury appearance commanded
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and give evidence.

events.title: Time period of interest for recipient's activities
events.description: The subpoena demands materials establishing the recipient's location and activities from 8 a.m. on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Time period of interest for recipient's activities
events.description: The subpoena demands materials establishing the recipient's location and activities until 12 p.m. on August 10, 2019.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 12, 2019, for an appearance on August 16, 2019, indicating active grand jury proceedings in the Southern District of New York related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The subpoena demands all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including communications and documents, showing a broad investigative scope.

It specifically demands materials to establish the recipient's location and activities between August 9, 2019, 8 a.m. and August 10, 2019, 12 p.m., suggesting these dates are of particular investigative interest.
The subpoena is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, indicating high-level DOJ involvement.
The subpoena references potential violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction of records), hinting at the nature of the investigation.
